When I get my finger stuck in a bottle, I pull it it out for sweet mercy, 
thinking that this may finally be the end, —the day I got my finger stuck 
in a bottle—but my effort prevails! my finger falls out of the bottle, and 
I'm overcome with a sensation of relief and triumph over the glass fiend's 
loss. Shortly afterwards ... I insert my finger again.﻿

comments.author: shiningstar senorita

comments.text:
One time in high school I decided to get on a random school bus and see 
where it takes me. I live in a fairly small town, so I figured that I could 
walk home from wherever I ended up.
The problem is, I didn't know just how far my high school's boundaries 
covered. I started getting nervous when the bus I got on went into the bad 
part of town, then got on the highway, then went past a bunch of power 
plants and factories. After about fifteen minutes, I had no idea where I 
was. I was in the middle of nowhere.
I eventually admitted to the bus driver that I had "accidentally" gotten on 
the wrong bus. She wasn't that surprised, since she didn't recognize me as 
one of her regular riders. She had to stop the bus and we sat there for at 
least ten minutes (delaying all the other kids who wanted to get home), 
waiting for her boss to show up and drive me home. He dropped me off near 
the school, and I walked home. Luckily, my mom wasn't home to notice that I 
showed up late, so I didn't have to explain my little adventure to her.
The title of this video made me think of the story.﻿

One time my cousin was changing her baby's diaper so she took off her 
wedding ring and gave it to me so she wouldn't scratch the baby. After she 
finished changing the baby's diaper, she decided to go to the bathroom.

frantically tried to pull it off before she came out of the bathroom and 
luckily, it came off. ﻿
